column1: '''Fortinbras Took I''' was the twenty-fifth [[Thain]] of [[the Shire]].
Fortinbras was the son of [[Ferumbras Took II
column2: Ferumbras II]]. He inherited the Thainship upon his father's death in {{SR
column3: 1201}}, and passed it on to his son [[Gerontius Took

column2: Fortinbras]] is the name of two characters in Shakespeare's ''[[wikipedia:Hamlet
column3: Hamlet]]''. It is French for "strong in arms".<ref>[[Jim Allan]] (ed.), ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', "Giving of Names"</ref>
